fields.description: Some users do not use SSH so it should be able to disable all SSH features.
fields.summary: Add an option to diable all SSH.

fields.description: We are some way behind the current versions of Mercurial and its extensions. We should update.
fields.summary: Review Mercurial embedded version and extensions.

fields.description:
Hello
Its annoying that SourceTree tries to automatically detect the system git to use (Options » Git » Git Version): it always selects the wrong local git.
It would be a great help if we could manually change / select which git it has to use.

Thanks a lot in advance,
kind regards,
Tom
fields.summary: Please allow selecting which system git to use

fields.description:
Our team creates new branches through JIRA, which can result in lots of feature/ and bugfix/ branches.

We clean up once our pull requests are removed and our branches are merged, but this does not clean up each others' remote branches, even with a "refresh remote status" command.

However, if each of us DELETE the remote repo and re-connect to it, we see a cleaned branch status.

Before deleting remote and re-establishing remote connection: !Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Deleting a remote branch does not delete remote branch for other team members

fields.description:
This issue predates 1.8.2-WIN (not sure how far back) but persists through 1.8.2.3-WIN. I'm on Windows 7.

When viewing a repo's unstaged files, the Path column's values cannot be trusted after scrolling.

For example, suppose my view includes:

* 3 files in the repo root (Path is therefore blank)
* 1 file in a "lib" directory
* 10 files in a "test" directory

After scrolling down, then back up, the 3 files in the repo root no longer have a blank Path value, but instead are listed as being in the "test" directory.

Refreshing via F5 or clicking on a column header seems to reset things, but then re-scrolling messes them back up again.
fields.summary: "Path" in "Unstaged files" list gets messed up after scroll down

fields.description: I was in the working in the "working copy" view of the repo, deciding on what files to stage, and I typed into the search filter field (top right), and hit backspace key, and kept typing more, and it crashed on me.
fields.summary: crash using search filter feature

fields.description:
As a user I would like to see a menu option to rest the repo to the Head from the get server so that I can easily revert to a server copy of my files. 

Terminal Command: GIT RESET --HARD HEAD^
fields.summary: Button / Menu Option to Rest Head

fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when focusing on commit message box in file status tab

fields.description:
Triggered committing staged files that also included changed files within a submodule.
After clicking on "Actions" button within the submodule dialog, the program has been crashed.
Log file is attached.
fields.summary: Crash after commit including submodule

fields.description:
When the 'check default remotes for updates every X minutes" option is selected, trying to use the commands (Fetch, Pull) will cause Sourcetree to hang. The progress bar keeps moving and the full output shows the relevant git command, but nothing appears to actually work until SourceTree is restarted.

When the check default remotes option is not selected, this doesn't happen.
fields.summary: Check default remotes causes git commands to hang

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian, 

I'm Martino, is possible to Select de Branches name when i put mouse hover on it? Not change my Branch's position only select for to see that i'm hover it.
fields.summary: Mouse hover Branchs name

fields.description:
Sourcetree crashed on me twice in a row, when I tried to do the exact same thing.
Namely:
* Tried to commit to an existing Git branch, not the master.
* Ticked some, but not all, of the modified files.
* Clicked "commit", with the "push immediately..." checkbox unticked.
* Sourcetree gives me a dialogue box telling me a sub-repo has uncommited changes.
* I click the "Open..." button for the sub-repo. Then the entire program crashes, displaying an apologising dialogue box.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashing when trying to open sub-repo

fields.description:
screen 1
!http://s1.radikali.ru/uploads/2016/2/24/665116ae1bf509574c2a649fcb9562c6-full.png!

screen 2
!http://s1.radikali.ru/uploads/2016/2/24/6c15fde9b05247d1c75cdf2ca1aff3c1-full.png!
fields.summary: Bad font

fields.description: If you select file in change list by pressing space bar, then commit button remains disabled. It gets enabled only after you click on any item in change list.
fields.summary: Commit button disabled

fields.description:
When files get modified, it gets displayed under the Unstaged files window. As a user, If I have the facility to sort the displayed files as per name or modified time, it would be easier to select the files for check in.  I can give an example to explain where this would be useful.

In Visual Studio, when you create a new form, for example. Customer, it generates two files, Customer.designer and Customer.cs.   Currently, as there is no provision to sort the files, sometimes the user may end up checking in one of the files instead of both the files because the other file may be in the bottom of the list especially during manual selection.

It would be very useful, if you bring in this feature in the tool.

The next one is, ability to close all the open tabs. When you open a repo, it opened as a tab on the right hand side. After a period of time, you may end up with so many tabs and it would be helpful if we have a command just to close all open tabs or except the current one, etc.
fields.summary: Ability to sort the unstaged files displayed & Close all Tabs

fields.description: Please provide the ability to compare the same file across branches within the interface
fields.summary: Source compare across branches

fields.description:
Under the commit info, the author's email is replaced with the author's full name.

{code:javascript}
    Sample of one of my recent commits

Commit: 0f61122cae62c3e01fc9e1f0424e078bb6e86b91 [0f61122]
Parents: 2a7524f161
Author: Edward Thang <Edward Thang>
Date: Tuesday, 8 March, 2016 11:59:13
Commit Date: Tuesday, 8 March, 2016 14:27:25
{code}
fields.summary: Email is replaced by full name under commit Author

fields.description:
We just migrated to bit bucket and have to make extensive use of subtrees since we have several shared projects.

SourceTree seems to be unable to handle subtrees well.  First, when I try to add a link to a subtree, SourceTree fails to pass my credentials when trying to pull the branch.  I have to include my password in the URL for it to work, even though I have my credentials saved.  Not desirable!

Secondly, once I get the subtree linked, SourceTree often crashes when I try to refresh the link by selecting 'Pull Repository'.  Attached is the log of one of these crashes.
fields.summary: Crash when pulling Subtree

fields.description:
Using Windows 7 computer 

Right-clicked the bugfix branch selected Create Pull Request and Sourcetree crashed.
Right-clicked the bugfix branch selected Repository/Create Pull Request. 
Made choices from bugfix to remote development branch. It said it was okay, but the pull request did not appear in Bitbucket.  When I came back to close the window the crash message reappeared in Sourcetree. 
Tried again this time highlighted bugfix branch, then selected Repository, then pull-request.
Made my selections, then tried to Create Pull Request on web. The pull request did not appear, but the message window said it was successful.  Yet no pull request was in Bitbucket Server.
I closed the message window in Sourcetree and the crash occurred again.

Attached are some pictures and the sourcetree.log file.
fields.summary: Crash Trying to Create Pull Request bugfix branch

fields.description: As you can see in the attachment, the project listing panel is very cluttered. The important information is obviously the project name, but it is hard to see when the folder path is there. I suggest hiding the folder path, and only show it when you mouse-over the the row.
fields.summary: Project listing panel is very cluttered. Suggest only showing folder path on mouse-over

fields.description:
With the new icon set introduced in I believe version 1.8 I have difficulyty telling the difference between active and inactive menu items. They do highlight with a mouse-over but it's just grey on grey. 

It's fine to keep the minimalist buttons but perhaps on the active buttons use the "SourceTree Blue" instead of the slightly darker grey. Anything to be able to tell at a glance whether or not the button is active.
fields.summary: New Icon set: Difference between active and inactive buttons

fields.description:
This is an issue affecting also many previous versions.
When a project contains submodules, the list of them is displayed on the left pane.
An icon shows the submodule status (like 3 dots ... for modification)
Given I didn't find the docs on the precise meaning of icons I guessed
- "..." for modifications
- "up arrow" when it's time for a push

If I open the submodule, commit mods and push, I would expect to see the icon cleared. Many times the "up arrow" is still shown.

In general I found icons not reflecting properly the submodule state. This is not always true, though: other times they work properly.

Using git on same server with equivalent complex submodules
fields.summary: Status icons on submodule list are inconsistent

fields.description: Once on log/history view or file status view there is no horizontal scroll to see the whole line of code. Previous versions this was possible.
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bar on code window

fields.description:
There are 3 views to a repository: File Status, Log / History and Search. The File Status view seems to be set as the default view when opening a new repository and even after clicking on a different view, sometimes the interface reloads?! and the view changes back to File Status.

Please let the default view be configurable, so that each time I would open a new repository it would open in the previously used view or always use the default view that should be set in the options.

Most of the people I know use the Log / History view the most.
fields.summary: Set default repository view

fields.description:
The "Fetch all tags" check-box in the Fetch dialogue doesn't stay checked.

How to reproduce:
SourceTree v1.8.2.11 (also previous versions)
1. Press Fetch
2. Check "Fetch all tags"
3. Press OK
4. Press Fetch again
5. Notice how the check-box is unchecked

Either make it remember it's value like the other 2 check-boxes in the same dialogue or set a flag somewhere in the Options menu.
fields.summary: "Fetch all tags" check-box does not remember it's previous status

fields.description: When selecting and right clicking on the menus in sourcetree a menu would appear to allow several actions including adding remotes.  In this version of sourcetree that menu is not available.
fields.summary: Right Click Menu on Branches, Tags, and Remotes Not Appearing

fields.description:
I try to Clone existing remove repository from *bitbucket.org* and I see the following error:
warning: templates not found *C:\Users\<username>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local\share\git-core\templates*

the whole *share* folder and his subdirectories is missing
fields.summary: templates folder missing in git

fields.description:
- Created a release.
- Checked out this release 
- Git flow -> Finish release ( unchecked delete branch) -> ok
- no errors everything done although it is still checked out.
- checked out develop branch.
- Git flow -> Create new release 
- Got error can't create new release until you finish the previous one which I already finished.

 !image-2016-03-07-11-19-31-083.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Release doesn't finish

fields.description: The tree view list in the last version is very helpful for me to track some files in a specific folder. However, such feature seems to be removed in the latest version.
fields.summary: Tree View feature not supported in the latest version

fields.description:
Before this new release (with integrated login) I was able to open the container folder of a file in Windows Explorer. This action is now missing from the context menu.

Reproduction steps:
- Select Log/History Tab
- Adjust the filters to be able to see files
- Right click one file
- The context menu will not show the [Open in Explorer] action
fields.summary: Missing action Open in Explorer

fields.description: The little blue circle to the left of the current branch is not align to the center of the branch name. This is just annoying to look at :)
fields.summary: Circle next to the current branch is not center alligned

fields.description: Please bring back the ability to drag and drop file from the unstaged section to the staged section in the commit window.  This feature was removed in the big UI update and I miss it terribly
fields.summary: Drag and drop unstaged file to stages files

fields.description: No feedback to user. Click on Pull button (for example) no raise action window for a few seconds and not show wait cursor.
fields.summary: No wait cursor before raise window refresh operations.(Pull i.e)

fields.description: After upgrade to 1.8.2.11 running on Windows I'm unable to commit - commit button doesn't trigger any visible action except SourceTree window is loosing focus.
fields.summary: Unable to commit after upgrade to 1.8.2.11

fields.description:
I just update to 1.8.2.11 on Windows.

The "File Status" tab no longer seems to be working.  After modifying files, it always remains empty so I cannot commit from the UI.  If I launch a terminal, a "git status" shows the modified files I expect.

Restarting SourceTree seems to fix it for one commit.  After a restart, the UI shows the modified files.  However, after committing and then making new edits, those new edits no longer appear.

This is a major blocker to usability of the tool and for now I have to seek alternatives which I don't really want to do.
fields.summary: Modified files no longer appearing after update to 1.8.2.11
Unable to change tabs possitions

fields.description:
Before this version the feature to call on submodule was bugged (blank screen -> need to close dialog and restart commit) but was not crashing the application.

Now on committing and with SourceTree checking the submodules' state.
If you click on Open to pre-commit a submodule, the application just crash with a nice dialog to inform you about the critical failure.
fields.summary: Open Submodule on Commit -> Application Crashes

fields.description:
SourceTree will not respect the default browser that the user had set and will always use Internet Explorer/Edge (Windows) or Safari (Mac). This cause users not to be able to login to MyAtlassian via SourceTree and results with a HTTP Error 403. 

h4. Workaround
Update your Internet Explorer's/Edge default "Cookies" configuration to enabled
fields.summary: Upon login into MyAtlassian for the first time use, SourceTree does not use the default browser

fields.description:
Cannot use system git and open a repository
Dialog below:
---------------------------
Error encountered
---------------------------
'git status' failed with code -1: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
(F:\git\platform_api)
---------------------------
OK 
---------------------------
If I switch to embedded git, this problem does not appear.
fields.summary: Cannot open a repository when system git is enabled

fields.description:
Past last update the SourceTree shows all controls like disabled (dimmed, grayed). Though it works almost as usual. Some of controls are really disabled and doesn't work (which is ok).
Page (Tab) control can be switched but can't be rearranged. If I need switch (usually after open new one Tab) position of some panes I have to close all and open in right order.
fields.summary: broken UI - all controls are like disabled

fields.description:
You can create a branch (via Git Flow macros) with a name containing special characters, i. e. ä, ö, ü, ß. You can push that branch as well.
When you try to execute a "Finish feature", you'll get the error message: "No branch matches prefix '<branchname>'."

I suggest to either suppress those characters for branch names generally or to fix the problem in the merge process.
fields.summary: "Finish feature" impossible with special characters in branch name

fields.description:
Currently a selected file can be added to be staging area using either space or ctrl-shift-+ when already selected. However there is no easy way to select the first non-staged file, nor is there a way to (easily) scroll the selected file.

The basic workflow that needs support using only the keyboard is as follows:

1. Select first non-staged file (this should allow using the arrow keys to move up and down the non-staged files list)
2. Scroll through diff view
3a. Add entire file (this is currently possible) and select next file in non-staged list
3b. Stage hunk and keep non-staged file selected
3c. Stage lines and keep non-staged file selected (this part is nice to have)
4. Commit (currently possible)
fields.summary: Better keyboard shortcuts for staging

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Select a file in the Unstaged files area of the File Status tab. 
CORRECT: => The diff window presents the differences of the UNSTAGED hunks

2. Click on Stage Hunk for a Hunk to be staged 
CORRECT: => The diff window is updated to excluded the staged hunk and present the rest of the UNSTAGED hunks.

3. Click on the semi-staged file in the Staged Files area of the File Status tab. 
CORRECT: => The diff window presents the differences of the STAGED hunks.

4. Select some staged lines and click on the Unstage Lines button or click on Unstage Hunk 
*INCORRECT:* => The diff window presents the differences of the UNSTAGED hunks while the semi-staged file is selected in the Staged Files area.

5.*INCORRECT:* Even if the semi-staged file is re-selected the diff window is not updated (since the semi-staged file is already selected and there is no event triggered for change of selection).

6. WORKAROUND: Select another file anywhere and then select back the semi-staged file to get the correct updated view of the diff window.

7. EXPECTED: On unstaging of the lines selected either the semi-staged file should remain selected and the diff window be updated to exclude the unstaged lines (Preferable)

OR the semi-unstaged file should be selected and the diff window be update to show the unstaged hunks remaining 

BUT NOT the semi-STAGED file to be selected and the diff window to present the UNSTAGED hunks.
fields.summary: Staged files contents not updating correctly after unstaging hunks/lines

fields.description:
I logged in with these correct details:

Username: gideon.koh@servicerocket.com
Host: "bitbucket.org"

However, after the login, the authentication menu seems to show it wrongly:

Username: gideon.koh
Host: servicerocket.com@bitbucket.org

!authentication.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tools > Options > Authentication shows wrong username and host.

fields.description: On Windows, SourceTree is creating one entry per version in the "Programs and Features" control panel item. See screenshot.
fields.summary: SourceTree creates one programs and features entry per version

fields.description:
I tried an install repair, and an install modify - neither helped
I went to control panel to uninstall and there were two versions in the install list
I uninstalled them, one failed to uninstall, I rebooted and tried again, it still failed
control panel then offered to remove it from the list of installed programs
a reboot, and re-install of 1.8.2.11 was tried, it didn't launch again

I tried sourcetreeapp.com looking for older installs, and found none.

uninstalled, rebooted, I installed 1.6.22 as I had that .exe floating around

I then checked updates, and tried to install 1.8.2.9 but that failed 
"Error: unable to find resource on server. Please check if the URL is correct."
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.8.2.11 does not launch at all

fields.description:
Hello
After a git task is completed, we can check its result in the Console / Progress Dialog and then we have to click "Close" or we can press <Enter>.
In Windows, <Enter> usually is the key to commit changes, but closing a Dialog without changing something we use the ESC key.

Could you please add the ESC key too, to close the Console / Progress Dialog?

It would also be great to have the ESC key because its a key pressed with the left hand :-)

Thanks a lot in advance,
kind regards,
Tom
fields.summary: Please allow to use ESC to close the Console / Progress Dialog

fields.description: Bring back drag and drop from unstaged files to staged files. This was a super useful Feature that suddenly seems to be gone.
fields.summary: Bring back drag and drop from unstaged files to staged files

fields.description:
When cloning a repo from a service with an integration (eg Bitbucket or GitHub), it would be nice if SourceTree would automatically add an 'upstream' (perhaps configurable?) remote with the parent repo.  For repos where the ancestry tree is larger than 1, it would be nice if all ancestor repos were added as remotes, with each remote being named after the user owning that particular repo.

Examples:

User 'foo's repo 'bar' is a fork of user 'baz's repo of the same name.  No grandparent repo exists.  Remotes:
origin: git@bitbucket.org:foo/bar.git
upstream: git@bitbucket.org:baz/bar.git

User 'foo's repo 'bar' is a fork of user 'baz's repo of the same name, which is a fork of user 'quux's repo also of the same name.  Remotes:
origin: git@bitbucket.org:foo/bar.git
baz: git@bitbucket.org:baz/bar.git
quux: git@bitbucket.org:quux/bar.git

Of note, though, is that users can usually rename their repositories even if they're a fork, so you cannot rely on the parent repo's name matching up.
fields.summary: Include parent repository(/ies?) as remotes when cloning forks from services with integrations

fields.description:
Sourcetree crashes when trying to resolve conflict with diff tool.

This happens especially when merge conflict involves deleted files.
fields.summary: Source tree crashes when trying to resolve conflict using diff tool

fields.description:
When I refresh the log view (hitting f5), the log view jumps around. It seems that the program is trying to center the select log line. This is especially annoying as it often scrolls down so that the newest log line, which houses the changed code that I am refreshing to see, is not actually visible.

I'm not against the centering, but if the line is already in view, it would be much more helpful if the code didn't move around.
fields.summary: Log view jumps around during reffresh

fields.description: In the past, I could drag files that had been changed to the staging area and they would be added there. That no longer works, and I either have to click the checkmark box next to the field, or right click the file and choose add. I see no reason why this functionality would have been removed, so I am assuming it is a bug.
fields.summary: Drag and drop from changed to staging no longer works

fields.description:
gif attached.

UPDATE:
This causes serious issues when trying to discard certain files and keep the others.  The wrong files are discarded or the wrong files are checked in.  Causing lost work.  This is a serious issue.
fields.summary: Select all checkbox does not work as intended.  Does not select all files

fields.description: I would love to get an option to hide the repository paths in the bookmarks view. Mostly because I hate the scrollbar and it adds no real value or information since everything is cut off at the part where it would become relevant, you only see the start of the path anyway since everything else is already too long.
fields.summary: Option to hide repository paths

fields.description:
When looking at the SourceTree screenshots from 2012 (http://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/files/2016/02/2012.png) I noticed the line in the diff view that says how many lines and files changes is missing and I actually would like to have that back as it is often good to know.

Now you would argue, if I only noticed it now after looking at old screenshots, it might not be that useful after all when I did not miss it before? Reason is, I use GitHub a lot and it always has that info so I never noticed it missing for my non-GitHub projects.
fields.summary: Missing commit statistics line
Cannot open git terminal - Value cannot be null. Parameter name: startInfo

fields.description:
Attempt to add a commit to a repository with a submodule with uncommitted changes to bring up the following screen, and click the open button. SourceTree immediately crashes.

 !image-2016-03-04-11-27-59-988.png|thumbnail! 

I was experimenting with git submodules and ran into this bug. After restarting SourceTree I tried again and it still crashed.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes in Submodule Check Dialog

fields.description: If a model dialog opens (such an SSH login or SSH error message), you can click the main application window and it comes to the front hiding the model dialog and giving the appearance the application has hung. I've seen this with SSH dialogs - I'm not sure it applies to other windows. If parent-child relationships are set correctly then the Windows OS should prevent the dialog window going behind its parent.
fields.summary: Model dialogs from ssh are not child windows so go behind main window

fields.description: I was switching back and forth between File view and Log / History view. I'd just switched to File view and was typing in a file name when crash.
fields.summary: SourceTree Windows crash

fields.description: Title is self descriptive.
fields.summary: Copying diff lines copies also plus/minus

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unchecking of option "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" is not sustained after restarting SourceTree


h3. Environment
SourceTree 1.8.2.11 for Windows


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In SourceTree, go to menu {{Tools > Options > tab General}}
# Uncheck the "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" checkbox
# Click "Ok" to close the dialogue
# Go back to {{Tools > Options > tab General}}
# Note that the "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" box is still unchecked
# Exit SourceTree
# Start SourceTree
# Go to menu {{Tools > Options > tab General}}


h3. Expected Results
The checkbox "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" remains checked


h3. Actual Results
The checkbox "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" is unchecked
fields.summary: Unchecking of option "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" is not sustained after restarting SourceTree

fields.description: When using the split staged/unstaged view SourceTree used to support using the spacebar to move selected items from staged to unstaged and vice versa. It no longer does this since the reskinned version came out.
fields.summary: Space bar does not move Unstaged files to Staged in latest version

fields.description: SourceTree crashed while having a repo with a not fully merged index (after showing way to much message boxes)
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description:
Commit with message "Commit fo fix"
Commit with message "fixup! Commit fo fix"

Using the GUI ask for a "Rebase children of b532fae interactively..." using the parent of the "Commit fo fix" commit.
A window popsup, the full output content is :
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" rebase -i --autosquash b532fae224e8b47b7da4815cc95de76dfede5076
The window never closes.
I suspect the --autosquash to mess up with the order of the commits and that somehow leads to the hang.
I have to click "Cancel" to resume using ST.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase with a fixup! commmit hangs the GUI

fields.description:
The Tree View option in the File Status tab has disappeared after upgrading to latest.

I've tried to toggle the is a checkbox in Tools > Options > General > Enable Tree View in file listing option
fields.summary: TreeView is missing

fields.description: For large projects Graph columns is too small, while Description is too large. It would be perfect to choose and save the preferred column width.
fields.summary: Remember column widths in Log/History grid

fields.description:
I'd like to have a Beginner Mode for SourceTree, so that checking one box sets defaults suitable for the following:

1. Clone the master branch and one other chosen by the user from existing ones, or create a new branch named by the user.  Check out the non-master branch immediately.

2. Push the working branch automatically after every commit, preserving the name.

3. Pull from the remote master branch with the --ff-only switch, and push the local working branch immediately back to the server.

Think of Alice Hacker and Bob Wordsmith working together on a couple of text documents, with Alice doing all the technical stuff and Bob just getting a convenient alternative to sending drafts back and forth by e-mail.
fields.summary: Nontechie mode with convenient defaults

fields.description:
- open an hg repo
- add some cyrillic characters to file, e.g. {code}msgstr "Очистить корзину"{code}

expected: well drawn characters, as all apps and as on Mac version of SourceTree
actual: looks like shit printed with Chinese fonts (sorry for the word) - here's the font I mean: http://boku.ru/img/chin-font-opaque.png

ok on mac
was ok on win before
fields.summary: Cyrillic characters in diff are displayed in wrong font

fields.description:
In the past SourceTree showed me the branch name and dirty state of current checked out branch in lower right corner of the window. This isn't the case anymore since update 1.8.x!

- E.g. in merge conflict it is really hard to figure out the current status of git.
- E.g. working with submodules one couldn't see anymore if the submodule is on a branch or on detached head.

Please show the status again the current git status!

Remark:
It's cool to show the status on the lower right pane, but it would be even more cool if it is placed in a more visible place. Think about the terminal. The git status is _the_ information shown on a git prompt!
fields.summary: Git status not shown in lower right pane

fields.description:
Please refer to screenshot attached.

I selected "6", then Shift+Click "2", but the range selection does not work correctly:
(Missing selection for 6 and added unwanted 7, causing non-contiguous selection and therefore unable to stage lines)
fields.summary: Line range not selected properly when selected from bottom to top

fields.description:
If a project moves, trying to open this in SourceTree shows the expected "Repository Missing" dialog, but the error state does not go away after specifying the correct folder.

To reproduce the issue:
* move an existing Git repository managed by SourceTree
* open project in SourceTree > "Repository Missing"
* click "Change Folder" and browse to the correct folder

At this point, the path displayed in the project tree does indeed update to the correct value, but the grey "synchronisation" icon remains and the "Repository Missing" message pops up again.

If I cancel the second prompt and restart SourceTree, the relocated repository then loads up without any issues, but this only clears after an application restart.
fields.summary: Repository path doesn't update cleanly after being moved

fields.description: When entering "bitbucket server" - which, fwiw, is *inside* our network - proxy is asked for (??? that seems brain dead). When valid proxy details are entered, ST crashes.
fields.summary: Crashes on boot when entering proxy info

fields.description:
Hi,

Recently I've updated SourceTree and find a new dialog while I'm staging files.
This (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/236337/sourcetree-can-you-disable-the-confirm-stage-dialog) OSX tip won't worked for me.

Thanks
fields.summary: Disable "confirm stage dialog"

fields.description: There used to be an option when right clicking files to open the folder in which it resides in the Explorer. This is now missing in the redesign and I would really love to have it back as it is a major setback in usability
fields.summary: Missing option to open folder

fields.description:
Selecting a contiguous line segment and staging/unstaging those lines normally works, but it is possible to get into a bad state.

Example: 10 lines currently unstaged
1. Select lines 3 and 5.
2. Attempt to stage (fails).
3. Select lines 5-10.
4. Attempt to stage (fails).
5. Select line 1.
6. Attempt to stage (fails).
7. Select lines 1-10.
8. Attempt to stage (succeeds).

Until the view is reset (switch to a different file and switch back), you cannot stage any line segment that does not contain all lines that were selected during the original attempt to stage. Oddly, though, if the selection includes the line above or below those original lines, it will automatically add them to the selection and succeed. Using the previous example, attempting to stage 1-4 would stage 1-5, and attempting to stage line 4 by itself would stage lines 3-5.
fields.summary: Can't stage/unstage contiguous line segment

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Right-click on a remote branch and select "Pull ... into current branch".
2. The Pull dialog shows to pull the current branch, not the branch right-clicked on.

 !image-2016-03-03-19-34-14-947.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Right-clicking and selecting "Pull <branch_name> into current branch" sets the wrong branch name in the Pull dialog

fields.description:
Every few minutes I get these alerts pop up:

---------------------------
git-remote-https.exe - Entry Point Not Found
---------------------------
The procedure entry point EVP_aes_128_ctr could not be located in the dynamic link library C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local\mingw32\bin\libssh2-1.dll. 
---------------------------


---------------------------
git-remote-https.exe - Entry Point Not Found
---------------------------
The procedure entry point ERR_remove_thread_state could not be located in the dynamic link library C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local\mingw32\bin\libcurl-4.dll. 
---------------------------


I have re-installed SourceTree and I have updated the embedded git but I still get the errors.

fields.description:
You can actually fetch, pull and push to the expandable category 'Remotes'... with a right click.  This will result obviously in an error:

{code}git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch Remotes
fatal: 'Remotes' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.





Completed with errors, see above.
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to fetch, pull, and push the 'Remotes' category

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When staging a file on Sourcetree, the diff will disappear after hitting F5 to refresh it when the selected file is in the staged area.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Windows 7
* Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Stage a file on Sourcetree
# Select and highlight the staged file.
# Press F5 to refresh the diff view

h3. Expected Results
The diff view should refresh and show the diffs of the staged file

h3. Actual Results
The diff view disappears from view

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment other than downgrading to an older version of Sourcetree
fields.summary: Split view stage diff disappears on refresh for staged files

fields.description:
- go to commit
- select all files
- click top checkmark to theck them all
- select several files

expected: any way to deselect a group of files
actual: no way (but for selecting, there's Commit contextual menu item)

can be fixed wither with space (see related), or by making click on one item to deselect all selected
fields.summary: Cannot uncheck several selected files

fields.description:
Once we finish a hotfix, by default 'tag with this message' is enabled by default. This is fine, but if we give a custom tag message (see screenshot) the name of the tag does not change. 

For 'finish release' this propperly works. We think the label should be something like: "Publish tag, and provide optional custom tag name".
fields.summary: [Git Flow] "Tag with message" does not change tag name

fields.description:
- work with hg repo
- merge
- go to commit
- select a file
- select another file

expected: diff
actual: no diff (see the screenshot attached)

note: I don't know the exact case but this happens to me about 5 times per day with diffs showing about 100..200 times

workaround: hit F5 on commit tab

impact: annoying issue... don't like it, ok on mac, was ok before on win as well
fields.summary: No diff on merge commit (unstable case)

fields.description:
- open an hg repo with changes
- click Commit
- select an file in Pending files tab
- hit Space

expected: the file is checked/unchecked
actual: no action
fields.summary: Cannot check/uncheck commit files with space key
